alert.note: Alert for Huerfano; Las Animas (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 07 at 6:13PM MDT until August 07 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR EAST CENTRAL HUERFANO AND NORTHWESTERN LAS ANIMAS COUNTIES... At 613 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain has ending across the warned area. However, flash flooding is likely ongoing at this time. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...A storm spotter reported 1.75 inches of rain 5 miles south of Walsenburg with law enforcement reporting flooding on Huerfano County Road 340. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Walsenburg. This includes the following high risk locations... North Abeyta Creek at Highway 160 bridge. This includes the following streams and drainages... Pictou Arroyo, Cucharas River, Sand Arroyo, Mayne Arroyo, Maitland Arroyo, Tejana Arroyo, South Santa Clara Creek, Salado Creek, Apishapa River, Santa Clara Creek and Walsen Arroyo. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
